intro: Decaspermum albociliatum, commonly known as the white-fringed spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish flowers that are surrounded by green bracts. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
